title: How to use mrangr?
text: vignette demonstrates main workflow mrangr package, designed simulate metacommunities within spatially explicit, mechanistic framework. package builds upon functionality earlier rangr package (https://github.com/ropensci/rangr), focused simulating single-species population dynamics dispersal. mrangr extends adding ability include multiple interacting species via asymmetric interaction matrix, allowing flexible modelling type biotic interaction.

title: How to use mrangr?
text: vignette shows : Create virtual community. Run simulation. Visualise results. Collect virtual ecologist data.

title: How to use mrangr?
text: first step install load mrangr package. Since maps simulation takes place must SpatRaster format, also install load terra package make easier manipulate visualise.
code: install.packages("mrangr") library(mrangr) install.packages("terra") library(terra)

title: How to use mrangr?
text: One required inputs set maps specify abundance virtual species start simulation (n1_map), well carrying capacity maps species community (K_map). provided examples mrangr. can find information datasets help files: Now, let’s load plot maps.   rasters four layers. means ready simulations involving four species, layer representing either carrying capacity initial abundance species. order layers crucial must consistent across simulation parameters (e.g., species 1 corresponds first layer input maps, first row column interaction matrix, ). begin, input maps generated using K_sim function, creates spatially autocorrelated rasters (e.g., representing carrying capacity). Subsequent steps require user specify number species supply template raster define simulation’s spatial extent resolution. generated raster two layers. layer represents carrying capacity map given virtual species. example, carrying capacity maps generated using log-normal distribution; however, distribution can used specifying appropriate quantile function.
code: ?K_map_eg.tif ?n1_map_eg.tif # Carrying capacity K_map_eg <- rast(system.file("input_maps/K_map_eg.tif", package = "mrangr")) plot(K_map_eg, main = paste0("K_", names(K_map_eg))) # Initial abundance n1_map_eg <- rast(system.file("input_maps/n1_map_eg.tif", package = "mrangr")) plot(n1_map_eg ,main = paste0("n1_", names(n1_map_eg))) # define species number nspec <- 2 # define map dimensions nrows <- ncols <- 100  # prepare template raster xmin <- 250000; xmax <- xmin + nrows * 1000 ymin <- 600000; ymax <- ymin + ncols * 1000 id <- rast(nrows = nrows, ncols = ncols, xmin = xmin, xmax = xmax, ymin = ymin, ymax = ymax) crs(id) <- "epsg:2180" id  # generate autocorrelated carrying capacity maps K_map <- K_sim(n = nspec, id, range = 5e5, qfun = qlnorm, meanlog = 2, sdlog = 0.5) plot(K_map, main = paste0("K_", names(K_map)))

title: How to use mrangr?
text: next step define interspecific interactions, mrangr done using interaction matrix. row column matrix represents virtual species. Since using two species example, matrix 2×2. values within matrix represent per-capita interaction strength species column species row. interaction ultimately realised change carrying capacity. , define symmetric competitive interaction two species:
code: a <- matrix(c(NA, -0.8, -0.8, NA), nrow = nspec, ncol = nspec) print(a) #>      [,1] [,2] #> [1,]   NA -0.8 #> [2,] -0.8   NA

title: How to use mrangr?
text: Now defined carrying capacity maps interactions, can use initialize_com function create community. function returns object class sim_com_data, contains necessary data running community simulation. previous sections, prepared K_map, used define first metacommunity. However, also necessary pass several additional arguments. detailed breakdown : n1_map SpatRaster object specifying initial abundance species (example, set half carrying capacity). r parameter sets population’s intrinsic growth rate. may provide unique value species use single value species, case. default population growth function Gompertz function. rate parameter linked kernel_fun parameter, defaults exponential function (rexp). Consequently, rate determines shape dispersal kernel, mean dispersal distance 1/rate. essential parameter specified units input maps. case, metres. can now use summary take closer look first_com object.
code: first_com <- initialise_com(   n1_map = round(K_map / 2),    K_map = K_map,    r = 1.1,    a = a,    rate = 1 / 500) summary(first_com) #> Summary of sim_com_data object #>  #> Input maps (K_map and n1_map) summary by species: #>  species n1_min n1_mean n1_max K_min K_mean K_max #>        1      1    4.20     16  2.05   8.40 32.19 #>        2      1    4.21     13  2.38   8.43 26.93 #>  #> Species-specific parameters: #>  species   r r_sd K_sd A dens_dep kernel  kernel_args #>        1 1.1    0    0 -      K2N "rexp" rate = 0.002 #>        2 1.1    0    0 -      K2N "rexp" rate = 0.002 #>  #> Interaction matrix (a): #>      1    2 #> 1   NA -0.8 #> 2 -0.8   NA

title: How to use mrangr?
text: need run simulation sim_com_data object number steps wish simulate. Optionally, can use burn parameter discard initial time steps, omit example. Now, let’s examine summary first simulation. summary reveals following key information: function sim_com returns object class sim_com_results. mean abundance across species relatively similar. simulation executed 100 time steps. None species experienced extinction simulation.
code: first_sim <- sim_com(first_com, time = 100) summary(first_sim) #> Summary of sim_com_results object #>  #> Abundances summary:  #>   species min q1 median mean q3 max #> 1       1   0  0      3 5.20  9  45 #> 2       2   0  0      3 5.16  9  41 #>  #> Simulated time steps:  100  #>  #> Extinction:  #>     1     2  #> FALSE FALSE

title: How to use mrangr?
text: take closer look final step simulation, use plot() function.  initial spatial distribution set proportional carrying capacity species’ habitat, effectively representing fundamental niches. Following simulation, competitive exclusion drove species’ ranges become almost entirely separate. resulting distribution maps illustrate species’ final realised niches.
code: plot(first_sim, time = c(1, 10, 100))

title: How to use mrangr?
text: can also use plot_series() function plot mean species abundances time steps.
code: plot_series(first_sim) legend("bottomright", title = "Species", legend = 1:nspec,         lty = 1:nspec, lwd = 2, col = 1:nspec)

title: How to use mrangr?
text: final component basic workflow virtual_ecologist() function. serves simulate real-world observation process, allowing user sample simulated community abundances defined points space time. step crucial incorporating effects sampling effort detection probability analysis. demonstration, used sampling strategy type = "random_one_layer", meaning random set cells sampled time step. prop argument controls proportion cells sampled. Let’s inspect structure resulting data.frame. output data.frame includes following six columns: id: Unique cell identifier. x, y: Sampled cell coordinates. species: Species number name. time: Sampled time step. n: Sampled abundance. alternative usage virtual_ecologist() supply data.frame pre-defines sampling design, containing columns "x", "y", "time". specifies spatial temporal points interest observation.

title: How to use mrangr?
text: vignette, demonstrated key functionalities mrangr package, specifically : Initialize multi-species community using initialise_com() function. Run spatially explicit simulations sim_com(). Visualize outputs using plot() track abundance changes time plot_series(). Generate simulated observation data (sampling) via virtual_ecologist() function. Collectively, tools establish mrangr powerful framework mechanistic, spatially explicit metacommunity simulation.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Katarzyna Markowska. Author, maintainer, copyright holder. Lechosław Kuczyński. Author, copyright holder.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Markowska K, Kuczyński L (2025). mrangr: Mechanistic Metacommunity Simulator. R package version 1.0.1.
code: @Manual{mrangr,   title = {mrangr: Mechanistic Metacommunity Simulator},   author = {Katarzyna Markowska and Lechosław Kuczyński},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 1.0.1}, }

title: Mechanistic Metacommunity Simulator
text: mrangr package designed simulate metacommunities within spatially explicit, mechanistic framework. extends functionality rangr package allowing simulation multiple interacting species via asymmetric interaction matrix. tool mimics essential processes shaping metacommunity dynamics: local population growth, dispersal, interspecific interactions. Simulations take place dynamic environments, facilitating projections community shifts response environmental changes.

title: Mechanistic Metacommunity Simulator
text: can install mrangr :
code: install.packages("mrangr")

title: Mechanistic Metacommunity Simulator
text: mrangr workflow involves initialising community spatial data interaction parameters, running simulation, analysing results.

title: Mechanistic Metacommunity Simulator
text: must provide carrying capacity maps (K_map) initial abundance maps (n1_map) SpatRaster objects. community NN species, rasters must contain NN layers. Interspecific interactions defined using interaction matrix (aa), values represent per-capita interaction strength species column species row.
code: # Load example maps K_map <- rast(system.file("input_maps/K_map_eg.tif", package = "mrangr")) K_map <- subset(K_map, 1:2) # Example for 2 species with symmetric competition nspec <- 2 a <- matrix(c(NA, -0.8, -0.8, NA), nrow = nspec, ncol = nspec)

title: Mechanistic Metacommunity Simulator
text: Use initialise_com() create sim_com_data object. stores parameters, including intrinsic growth rate (rr) dispersal rate.
code: first_com <- initialise_com(   n1_map = round(K_map / 2),    K_map = K_map,    r = 1.1,    a = a,    rate = 1 / 500 )

title: Mechanistic Metacommunity Simulator
text: sim_com() function executes simulation specified number time steps.
code: first_sim <- sim_com(first_com, time = 100)

title: Mechanistic Metacommunity Simulator
text: can visualise final spatial distributions change mean abundance time.
code: # Visualise spatial niches at specific time steps plot(first_sim, time = c(1, 10, 100)) # Plot abundance time series for all species plot_series(first_sim)

title: Mechanistic Metacommunity Simulator
text: package includes virtual_ecologist() function simulate real-world observation processes. allows users sample simulated community defined points space time, incorporating sampling effort detection probability simulation.

title: Mechanistic Metacommunity Simulator
text: cite mrangr, please use citation() function:
code: library(mrangr) citation("mrangr")

title: Mechanistic Metacommunity Simulator
text: work supported National Science Centre, Poland, grant . 2018/29/B/NZ8/00066 Poznań Supercomputing Networking Centre (grant . pl0090-01).

what: Example Of Carrying Capacity Map — K_map_eg.tif
title: Example Of Carrying Capacity Map — K_map_eg.tif
text: SpatRaster object 4 layer can passed initialise_com simulation (sim_com) starting point. map compatible n1_map_eg.tif.

title: Example Of Carrying Capacity Map — K_map_eg.tif
text: SpatRaster object 4 layers, 15 rows 15 columns. Contains numeric values representing carrying capacity NA's indicating unsuitable areas.

title: Example Of Carrying Capacity Map — K_map_eg.tif
text: Data generated -house serve example (using spatial autocorrelation).

title: Example Of Carrying Capacity Map — K_map_eg.tif
code: terra::rast(system.file("input_maps/K_map_eg.tif", package = "mrangr")) #> class       : SpatRaster  #> size        : 15, 15, 4  (nrow, ncol, nlyr) #> resolution  : 1000, 1000  (x, y) #> extent      : 250000, 265000, 6e+05, 615000  (xmin, xmax, ymin, ymax) #> coord. ref. : ETRF2000-PL / CS92 (EPSG:2180)  #> source      : K_map_eg.tif  #> names       :         1,         2,        3,         4  #> min values  :  2.521231,  1.747702,  2.76080,  1.785377  #> max values  : 32.832001, 18.041435, 25.07158, 24.817247

title: Carrying Capacity Map Simulator — K_sim
text: Generates multiple carrying capacity maps based spatially autocorrelated Gaussian Random Fields (GRFs), optional correlation layers.

title: Carrying Capacity Map Simulator — K_sim
code: K_sim(n, id, range, cor_mat = NULL, qfun = qnorm, ...)

title: Carrying Capacity Map Simulator — K_sim
text: n Integer. Number maps generate. id SpatRaster object used geographic template. range Numeric. Spatial autocorrelation parameter passed grf function. cor_mat Optional correlation matrix. NULL, maps generated independently. qfun Quantile function apply generated GRFs (default: qnorm). ... Additional arguments passed quantile function qfun.

title: Carrying Capacity Map Simulator — K_sim
text: SpatRaster object n layers, representing carrying capacity map.

title: Carrying Capacity Map Simulator — K_sim
code: library(terra) #> terra 1.8.93 library(FieldSimR)  # Community parameters nspec <- 3 nrows <- ncols <- 10 xmin <- 250000; xmax <- xmin + nrows * 1000 ymin <- 600000; ymax <- ymin + ncols * 1000 id <- rast(nrows = nrows, ncols = ncols, xmin = xmin, xmax = xmax, ymin = ymin, ymax = ymax) crs(id) <- "epsg:2180" plot(id)   # Correlation matrix of carrying capacities cor_mat <- matrix(c(1, 0.29, 0.32, 0.29, 1, 0.32, 0.32, 0.32, 1), nrow = nspec, ncol = nspec) cor_mat #>      [,1] [,2] [,3] #> [1,] 1.00 0.29 0.32 #> [2,] 0.29 1.00 0.32 #> [3,] 0.32 0.32 1.00  # Generate and define the distributions and parameters of correlated carrying capacity maps K_map <- K_sim(nspec, id, range = 20000, cor_mat = cor_mat, qfun = qlnorm, meanlog = 2, sdlog = 0.5) K_map #> class       : SpatRaster  #> size        : 10, 10, 3  (nrow, ncol, nlyr) #> resolution  : 1000, 1000  (x, y) #> extent      : 250000, 260000, 6e+05, 610000  (xmin, xmax, ymin, ymax) #> coord. ref. : ETRF2000-PL / CS92 (EPSG:2180)  #> source(s)   : memory #> names       :         1,         2,         3  #> min values  :  1.991756,  2.115014,  2.723308  #> max values  : 26.002093, 22.648015, 16.972968  hist(K_map)  plot(K_map)

text: square numeric matrix representing interaction coefficients species. a_ij per-capita interaction strength species j species . expresses change carrying capacity species single individual species j. data compatible n1_map_eg.tif K_map_eg.tif maps.

code: a_eg

code: diagonal(x)

text: x raster object.

title: Load Example Community Object — get_community
text: Loads pre-simulated example spatial community object, useful demos testing.

title: Load Example Community Object — get_community
code: get_community()

title: Load Example Community Object — get_community
text: object class sim_com_data containing community structure, simulation parameters, species-specific carrying capacity initial abundance maps.

title: Load Example Community Object — get_community
code: community <- get_community() summary(community) #> Summary of sim_com_data object #>  #> Input maps (K_map and n1_map) summary by species: #>  species invader n1_min n1_mean n1_max K_min K_mean K_max #>        1    TRUE      0    0.00      0  2.52   8.55 32.83 #>        2   FALSE      0    8.10     20  1.75   8.08 18.04 #>        3    TRUE      0    0.00      0  2.76   8.57 25.07 #>        4   FALSE      0    9.02     31  1.79   8.93 24.82 #>  #> Species-specific parameters: #>  species invader   r r_sd K_sd A dens_dep kernel  kernel_args #>        1    TRUE 1.1    0    0 -      K2N "rexp" rate = 0.002 #>        2   FALSE 1.1    0    0 -      K2N "rexp" rate = 0.002 #>        3    TRUE 1.1    0    0 -      K2N "rexp" rate = 0.002 #>        4   FALSE 1.1    0    0 -      K2N "rexp" rate = 0.002 #>  #> Interaction matrix (a): #>       1     2     3     4 #> 1    NA -1.04 -0.16 -0.56 #> 2 -0.32    NA  0.25 -0.45 #> 3 -1.27 -0.55    NA  0.24 #> 4 -0.64 -0.38  0.21    NA #>  #> Invasion settings: #>   Invader species: 1, 3 #>   Propagule size: 1 #>   Invasion times (rows: species, columns: time step): #>  #>     t1 t2 #>   1  2  5 #>   3  2  5

what: Load Example Simulated Community Results — get_simulated_com

text: Loads pre-run simulation output, based example community data. Useful examples, unit tests, visualization.

title: Load Example Simulated Community Results — get_simulated_com
code: get_simulated_com()

title: Load Example Simulated Community Results — get_simulated_com
text: object class sim_com_results containing simulation output community time.

title: Load Example Simulated Community Results — get_simulated_com
code: sim <- get_simulated_com() plot(sim)

what: Generate a Gaussian Random Field — grf
title: Generate a Gaussian Random Field — grf
text: Generates Gaussian random field (GRF) based Matern model spatial autocorrelation.

title: Generate a Gaussian Random Field — grf
code: grf(x, range, fun = "scale", ...)

title: Generate a Gaussian Random Field — grf
text: x template raster class SpatRaster (terra package). range Numeric. range parameter variogram model (spatial units x raster). fun function apply generated values (default scale standardize GRF). ... Additional arguments passed function specified fun.

title: Generate a Gaussian Random Field — grf
text: SpatRaster object containing generated Gaussian random field.

title: Generate a Gaussian Random Field — grf
code: library(terra) r <- rast(nrows = 100, ncols = 100, xmin = 0, xmax = 100, ymin = 0, ymax = 100) grf_field <- grf(r, range = 30) plot(grf_field)

title: Initialise Community Simulation Data — initialise_com
text: Prepares community-level input data spatial simulation. function builds rangr::initialise() organising inputs multiple species interactions.

title: Initialise Community Simulation Data — initialise_com
code: initialise_com(   n1_map = NULL,   K_map,   r,   a,   dlist = NULL,   invasion = NULL,   use_names_K_map = TRUE,   ... )

title: Initialise Community Simulation Data — initialise_com
text: n1_map SpatRaster one layer per species representing initial abundance.  NULL (default), random initial values generated Poisson distribution using K_map. K_map SpatRaster one layer per species representing carrying capacities. r numeric vector intrinsic growth rates. can single-element vector (species intrinsic growth rate) vector length equal number species community. square numeric matrix representing interaction coefficients species. element a_ij per-capita interaction strength species j species . expresses change carrying capacity species single individual species j. diagonal must NA matrix must square matrix order equal number species. symmetric. dlist Optional. list; target cells specified distance calculated every cell within study area. invasion Optional. named list specifying invasion configuration (can prepared using initialise_inv). Must contain: invaders Integer vector invading species indices. propagule_size Number individuals introduced per invasion event. invasion_times Matrix invasion times, one row per invader. use_names_K_map Logical. TRUE, layer names K_map used species names. FALSE, species numbered sequentially (1:number_of_species). Defaults TRUE. ... Additional named arguments passed initialise(). must either length 1 equal number species. kernel_args Optional. list lists, containing named arguments corresponding species' kernel function. Must length number species.

title: Initialise Community Simulation Data — initialise_com
text: list class sim_com_data containing: spec_data list sim_data objects (one per species) returned initialise(). nspec number species. interaction matrix. r Intrinsic growth rate(s). n1_map Initial abundance maps (wrapped SpatRaster). K_map Carrying capacity maps (wrapped SpatRaster). max_dist maximum dispersal distance across species. dlist list; target cells specified distance calculated every cell within study area. invasion Invasion configuration (). call matched call.

title: Initialise Community Simulation Data — initialise_com
code: # \donttest{ library(terra)  # Read data from the mrangr package  ## Input maps K_map <- rast(system.file("input_maps/K_map_eg.tif", package = "mrangr")) n1_map <- rast(system.file("input_maps/n1_map_eg.tif", package = "mrangr"))  ## Interaction coefficients matrix a <- a_eg  # Initialise simulation parameters community_01 <-   initialise_com(   K_map = K_map,   n1_map = n1_map,   r = 1.1,   a = a,   rate = 0.002)  # With invaders invasion <- initialise_inv(   invaders = c(1, 3),   invasion_times = c(2, 5))  community_02 <- initialise_com(   K_map = K_map,   r = 1.1,   a = a,   rate = 0.002,   invasion = invasion)   # Custom kernel function abs_rnorm <- function(n, mean, sd) {   abs(rnorm(n, mean = mean, sd = sd)) }  community_03 <- initialise_com(   K_map = K_map,   n1_map = n1_map,   r = c(1.1, 1.05, 1.2, 1),   a = a,   kernel_fun = c("rexp", "rexp", "abs_rnorm", "abs_rnorm"),   kernel_args = list(     list(rate = 0.002),     list(rate = 0.001),     list(mean = 0, sd = 1000),     list(mean = 0, sd = 2000)) ) #> Error in get(as.character(FUN), mode = "function", envir = envir): object 'abs_rnorm' of mode 'function' was not found # }

title: Initialise Invasion Parameters — initialise_inv
text: Prepares list invasion configuration details, including identifiers invading species, times invasion number individuals introduced event. Result helper function designed passed initialise_com() invasion argument.

title: Initialise Invasion Parameters — initialise_inv
code: initialise_inv(invaders, invasion_times, propagule_size = 1)

title: Initialise Invasion Parameters — initialise_inv
text: invaders integer vector species indices indicating species invaders.indices match species layers input maps (n1_map K_map). invasion_times matrix vector specifying invader enters system. vector provided, assumed apply invaders. matrix, must one row per invader columns corresponding invasion events. propagule_size numeric scalar specifying number individuals introduced invasion time. Defaults 1.

title: Initialise Invasion Parameters — initialise_inv
text: named list following components: invaders Integer vector invading species indices. propagule_size Number individuals introduced per invasion event. invasion_times Matrix invasion times, one row per invader.

title: Initialise Invasion Parameters — initialise_inv
code: # Define invaders and invasion times initialise_inv(   invaders = c(1, 3),   invasion_times = matrix(c(5, 10, 5, 20), nrow = 2, byrow = TRUE),   propagule_size = 10 ) #> $invaders #> [1] 1 3 #>  #> $propagule_size #> [1] 10 #>  #> $invasion_times #>      [,1] [,2] #> [1,]    5   10 #> [2,]    5   20 #>   # Uniform invasion times across all invaders initialise_inv(   invaders = c(2, 4),   invasion_times = c(5, 10, 15) ) #> $invaders #> [1] 2 4 #>  #> $propagule_size #> [1] 1 #>  #> $invasion_times #>      [,1] [,2] [,3] #> [1,]    5   10   15 #> [2,]    5   10   15 #>

title: mrangr: Mechanistic Metacommunity Simulator — mrangr-package
text: Flexible, mechanistic, spatially explicit simulator metacommunities. extends previous package - 'rangr' (see https://github.com/ropensci/rangr), implemented mechanistic virtual species simulator integrating population dynamics dispersal. 'mrangr' package adds ability simulate multiple species interacting asymmetric matrix pairwise relationships, allowing users model types biotic interactions — competitive, facilitative, neutral — within spatially explicit virtual environments.

title: mrangr: Mechanistic Metacommunity Simulator — mrangr-package
text: Maintainer: Katarzyna Markowska katarzyna.markowska@amu.edu.pl [copyright holder] Authors: Lechosław Kuczyński lechu@amu.edu.pl [copyright holder]

text: Data generated -house serve example.

title: Plot sim_com_results Object — plot.sim_com_results
text: Draws simulated abundance maps species time

title: Plot sim_com_results Object — plot.sim_com_results
code: # S3 method for class 'sim_com_results' plot(   x,   species = seq_len(dim(x$N_map)[4]),   time_points = x$sim_time,   type = "continuous",   main,   range,   ... )

title: Plot sim_com_results Object — plot.sim_com_results
text: x object class sim_com_results, returned sim_com(). species Integer vector. Species ID(s) plot. time_points Integer vector. Time step(s) plot (excluding burn-). type Character vector length 1. Type map: "continuous" (default), "classes" "interval"  (case-sensitive) main Character vector. Plot titles (one layer) range Numeric vector length 2. Range values used legend (type = "continuous"), default calculated N_map slot sim_com_results object ... arguments passed terra::plot

title: Plot sim_com_results Object — plot.sim_com_results
text: #' * length(time_points) == 1, returns SpatRaster species layers. one species selected multiple time points, returns single SpatRaster.

title: Plot sim_com_results Object — plot.sim_com_results
code: # Read simulation data from the mrangr package simulated_com <- get_simulated_com()  # Plot plot(simulated_com)

title: Community Time-Series Plot — plot_series
text: function plots community time-series given location time.

title: Community Time-Series Plot — plot_series
code: plot_series(   obj,   x = seq(dim(obj$N_map)[1]),   y = seq(dim(obj$N_map)[2]),   time = seq(obj$sim_time),   species = seq(dim(obj$N_map)[4]),   trans = NULL,   ... )

title: Community Time-Series Plot — plot_series
text: obj object class sim_com_results. x Indices x-dimension - first dimension obj$N_map (default: full range). y Indices y-dimension - second dimension obj$N_map (default: full range). time Indices time-dimension - third dimension obj$N_map (default: full range). species Indices species - fourth dimension obj$N_map (default: full range). trans optional function apply calculated mean series plotting (e.g., log, log1p). Defaults NULL (transformation). ... Additional graphical parameters passed plot.

title: Community Time-Series Plot — plot_series
text: Invisibly returns matrix mean (possibly transformed) abundance values species.

title: Community Time-Series Plot — plot_series
code: # Read simulation data from the mrangr package simulated_com <- get_simulated_com()  # Plot plot_series(simulated_com)  plot_series(simulated_com, x = 5:12, y = 1:5)  plot_series(simulated_com, time = 1:5)  plot_series(simulated_com, trans = log1p)

code: # Read community data from the mrangr package community <- get_community()  # Print print(community) #> Class: sim_com_data #>  #> Number of species: 4  #>  #> Species-specific parameters: #>  species invader   r r_sd K_sd A dens_dep kernel  kernel_args #>        1    TRUE 1.1    0    0 -      K2N "rexp" rate = 0.002 #>        2   FALSE 1.1    0    0 -      K2N "rexp" rate = 0.002 #>        3    TRUE 1.1    0    0 -      K2N "rexp" rate = 0.002 #>        4   FALSE 1.1    0    0 -      K2N "rexp" rate = 0.002 #>  #> Max dispersal distance across species (used to calculate 'dlist'): #>    2000 #>  #> Border types: #>    reprising  #>  #> K_map: #> class       : SpatRaster  #> size        : 15, 15, 4  (nrow, ncol, nlyr) #> resolution  : 1000, 1000  (x, y) #> extent      : 250000, 265000, 6e+05, 615000  (xmin, xmax, ymin, ymax) #> coord. ref. : ETRF2000-PL / CS92 (EPSG:2180)  #> source(s)   : memory #> names       :         1,         2,        3,         4  #> min values  :  2.521231,  1.747701,  2.76080,  1.785377  #> max values  : 32.832002, 18.041435, 25.07158, 24.817247  #>  #> n1_map: #> class       : SpatRaster  #> size        : 15, 15, 4  (nrow, ncol, nlyr) #> resolution  : 1000, 1000  (x, y) #> extent      : 250000, 265000, 6e+05, 615000  (xmin, xmax, ymin, ymax) #> coord. ref. : ETRF2000-PL / CS92 (EPSG:2180)  #> source(s)   : memory #> names       : 1,  2, 3,  4  #> min values  : 0,  0, 0,  0  #> max values  : 0, 20, 0, 31  #>  #> Competition matrix (a): #>       1     2     3     4 #> 1    NA -1.04 -0.16 -0.56 #> 2 -0.32    NA  0.25 -0.45 #> 3 -1.27 -0.55    NA  0.24 #> 4 -0.64 -0.38  0.21    NA #>  #> Invasion settings: #>   Invader species: 1, 3 #>   Propagule size: 1 #>   Invasion times (rows: species, columns: time step): #>  #>     t1 t2 #>   1  2  5 #>   3  2  5

title: Set Non-Missing Values to Zero — set_zero

what: Simulate Community Dynamics Over Time — sim_com
title: Simulate Community Dynamics Over Time — sim_com
text: function simulates species interactions population dynamics given period. accounts species invasions updates population abundances time step.

title: Simulate Community Dynamics Over Time — sim_com
code: sim_com(obj, time, burn = 0, progress_bar = TRUE)

title: Simulate Community Dynamics Over Time — sim_com
text: obj object class sim_com_data, returned initialise_com(). time Integer. Total number simulation steps. Must >= 2. burn Integer. Number initial burn-steps exclude output. Must >= 0 < time. progress_bar Logical. Whether display progress bar simulation.

title: Simulate Community Dynamics Over Time — sim_com
text: object class sim_com_results, list containing: extinction Named logical vector indicating species went extinct. sim_time Integer. Duration output simulation (excluding burn-). id SpatRaster object used geographic template. N_map 4D array [rows, cols, time, species] population abundances.

title: Simulate Community Dynamics Over Time — sim_com
Example Simulated Community Output — simulated_com_eg
text: sim_com_results object containing results 20-step simulation 4-species community. simulation generated using community_eg object. object can accessed via get_simulated_com function.

title: Example Simulated Community Output — simulated_com_eg
text: object class sim_com_results mrangr package generated using sim_com.

title: Convert sim_com_results to SpatRaster(s) — to_rast.sim_com_results
text: Converts simulated population abundance data sim_com_results object (produced sim_com()) SpatRaster objects.

title: Convert sim_com_results to SpatRaster(s) — to_rast.sim_com_results
code: # S3 method for class 'sim_com_results' to_rast(   obj,   species = seq_len(dim(obj$N_map)[4]),   time_points = obj$sim_time,   ... )

title: Convert sim_com_results to SpatRaster(s) — to_rast.sim_com_results
text: obj object class sim_com_results, returned sim_com(). species Integer vector. Species ID(s) extract. time_points Integer vector. Time step(s) extract (excluding burn-). ... Currently unused.

title: Convert sim_com_results to SpatRaster(s) — to_rast.sim_com_results
text: length(time_points) == 1, returns SpatRaster species layers. length(time_points) > 1, returns named list SpatRaster objects, one per species. one species selected multiple time points, returns single SpatRaster.

title: Convert sim_com_results to SpatRaster(s) — to_rast.sim_com_results
code: # Read simulation data from the mrangr package simulated_com <- get_simulated_com()  # Extract one timestep, all species r1 <- to_rast(simulated_com, time_points = 10)  # Extract multiple timesteps, one species r2 <- to_rast(simulated_com, species = 2, time_points = c(1, 5, 10))  # Extract multiple timesteps, multiple species r3 <- to_rast(simulated_com, species = c(1, 2), time_points = c(1, 5, 10))

title: Update sim_com_data Object — update.sim_com_data
text: Updates parameters used create sim_com_data object, returned initialise_com().

title: Update sim_com_data Object — update.sim_com_data
code: # S3 method for class 'sim_com_data' update(object, ..., evaluate = TRUE)

title: Update sim_com_data Object — update.sim_com_data
text: object sim_com_data object, returned initialise_com(). ... Named arguments update. valid arguments initialise_com(). kernel_fun updated, associated kernel_args (present previous call) also replaced. evaluate Logical (default TRUE). TRUE, function returns re-evaluated updated object; FALSE, returns updated function call without evaluating .

title: Update sim_com_data Object — update.sim_com_data
text: evaluate = TRUE, new sim_com_data object updated parameters. evaluate = FALSE, call object representing updated function call.

title: Update sim_com_data Object — update.sim_com_data
text: dispersal-related arguments max_dist, kernel_fun, kernel_args changed, existing dlist removed recalculated unless new dlist explicitly provided. n1_map K_map updated, dlist also removed ensure consistency.

title: Update sim_com_data Object — update.sim_com_data
code: # \donttest{ library(terra)  # Read data from the mrangr package  ## Input maps K_map <- rast(system.file("input_maps/K_map_eg.tif", package = "mrangr")) n1_map <- rast(system.file("input_maps/n1_map_eg.tif", package = "mrangr"))  ## Competition coefficients matrix a <- a_eg  # Initialise simulation parameters community_01 <-   initialise_com(   K_map = K_map,   r = 1.1,   a = a,   rate = 0.002)  # Update simulation parameters  # Custom kernel function abs_rnorm <- function(n, mean, sd) {   abs(rnorm(n, mean = mean, sd = sd)) }  community_02 <- update(community_01,   kernel_fun = c("rexp", "rexp", "abs_rnorm", "abs_rnorm"),   kernel_args = list(    list(rate = 0.002),    list(rate = 0.001),    list(mean = 0, sd = 1000),    list(mean = 0, sd = 2000))) #> Error in get(as.character(FUN), mode = "function", envir = envir): object 'abs_rnorm' of mode 'function' was not found # }

title: Virtual Ecologist — virtual_ecologist
text: Organizes extracts community data simulated community object based one three sampling methods: random proportion, constant random sites, user-provided sites.

title: Virtual Ecologist — virtual_ecologist
code: virtual_ecologist(   obj,   type = c("random_one_layer", "random_all_layers", "from_data"),   sites = NULL,   prop = 0.01,   obs_error = c("rlnorm", "rbinom"),   obs_error_param = NULL )

title: Virtual Ecologist — virtual_ecologist
text: obj object created sim_com() function, containing simulation data. type character vector length 1; describes sampling type (case-sensitive): "random_one_layer" - random selection cells abundances sampled; set selected cells used across time steps. "random_all_layers" - random selection cells abundances sampled; new set cells selected time step. "from_data" - user-defined selection cells abundances sampled; user required provide data.frame containing three columns: "x", "y" "time". sites optional data frame specifying sites data extraction. data frame must contain three columns: x, y time. prop numeric value 0 1. proportion cells randomly sample raster. obs_error character vector length 1; type distribution defines observation process: "rlnorm" (log-normal distribution) "rbinom" (binomial distribution). obs_error_param numeric vector length 1; standard deviation (log scale) random noise observation process "rlnorm" used, probability detection (success) "rbinom" used.

title: Virtual Ecologist — virtual_ecologist
text: data frame 6 columns: id: unique cell identifier (factor) x, y: sampled cell coordinates species: species number name time: sampled time step n: sampled abundance

title: Virtual Ecologist — virtual_ecologist
code: # Read simulated community data from the mrangr package simulated_com <- get_simulated_com()  # Option 1: Randomly sample sites (the same for each year) sampled_data_01 <- virtual_ecologist(simulated_com) head(sampled_data_01) #>   id      x      y species time  n #> 1  4 253500 614500       1    1  0 #> 2 66 255500 610500       1    1  0 #> 3  4 253500 614500       2    1 11 #> 4 66 255500 610500       2    1  4 #> 5  4 253500 614500       3    1  0 #> 6 66 255500 610500       3    1  0  # Option 2: Randomly sample sites (different for each year) sampled_data_02 <- virtual_ecologist(simulated_com, type = "random_all_layers") head(sampled_data_02) #>    id      x      y species time  n #> 1 196 250500 601500       1    1  0 #> 2  17 251500 613500       1    1 NA #> 3  77 251500 609500       1    2  0 #> 4  85 259500 609500       1    2  0 #> 5  22 256500 613500       1    3  0 #> 6  34 253500 612500       1    3  0  # Option 3: Sample sites based on user-provided data frame custom_sites <- data.frame(   x = c(250500, 252500, 254500),   y = c(600500, 602500, 604500),   time = c(1, 10, 20) ) sampled_data_03 <- virtual_ecologist(simulated_com, sites = custom_sites) head(sampled_data_03) #>    id      x      y species time  n #> 1 211 250500 600500       1    1  0 #> 2 183 252500 602500       1   10  0 #> 3 155 254500 604500       1   20  0 #> 4 211 250500 600500       2    1 17 #> 5 183 252500 602500       2   10  2 #> 6 155 254500 604500       2   20  0  # Option 4. Add noise - "rlnorm" sampled_data_04 <- virtual_ecologist(   simulated_com,   sites = custom_sites,   obs_error = "rlnorm",   obs_error_param = log(1.2) ) head(sampled_data_04) #>    id      x      y species time         n #> 1 211 250500 600500       1    1  0.000000 #> 2 183 252500 602500       1   10  0.000000 #> 3 155 254500 604500       1   20  0.000000 #> 4 211 250500 600500       2    1 23.374584 #> 5 183 252500 602500       2   10  2.219544 #> 6 155 254500 604500       2   20  0.000000  # Option 5. Add noise - "rbinom" sampled_data_05 <- virtual_ecologist(   simulated_com,   sites = custom_sites,   obs_error = "rbinom",   obs_error_param = 0.8 ) head(sampled_data_05) #>    id      x      y species time  n #> 1 211 250500 600500       1    1  0 #> 2 183 252500 602500       1   10  0 #> 3 155 254500 604500       1   20  0 #> 4 211 250500 600500       2    1 13 #> 5 183 252500 602500       2   10  2 #> 6 155 254500 604500       2   20  0
